IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: ENHANCE THE APPRECIATION OF AMERICA'S NATIONAL PARKS, PUBLIC LANDS AND HISTORIC PLACES.
IRS990.MissionDesc: JEFFERSON NATIONAL PARKS ASSOCIATION PROVIDES QUALITY EDUCATIONAL PRODUCTS AND RELATED SERVICES THAT ENHANCE PUBLIC UNDERSTANDING AND APPRECIATION OF AMERICA'S NATIONAL PARKS, PUBLIC LANDS AND HISTORIC PLACES.
IRS990.Desc: INTERPRETIVE MATERIALS AND PROGRAM OPERATIONS - THIS PROGRAM INCLUDES THE DISTRIBUTION AND SALE OF HISTORICAL AND EDUCATIONAL MATERIALS THAT INTERPRET THE GATEWAY ARCH NATIONAL PARK (F/K/A JEFFERSON NATIONAL EXPANSION MEMORIAL), ULYSSES S. GRANT NATIONAL HISTORIC SITE, MISSISSIPPI NATIONAL RIVER AND RECREATION AREA, MISSOURI NATIONAL RECREATIONAL RIVER, LITTLE ROCK CENTRAL HIGH SCHOOL NATIONAL HISTORIC SITE, VOYAGEURS NATIONAL PARK, STE. GENEVIEVE NATIONAL HISTORICAL PARK, PRESIDENT WILLIAM JEFFERSON CLINTON BIRTHPLACE HOME NATIONAL HISTORIC SITE, THE NATIONAL PARK SYSTEM, AND OTHER AREAS OR FACILITIES DEVELOPED BY OR IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE AND OTHER GOVERNMENTAL AGENCIES. ALL MATERIALS ARE APPROVED BY THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE AND OTHER GOVERNMENTAL PARTNERS WHICH DETERMINE THEIR APPROPRIATENESS. THUS, THE PROGRAM FULFILLS THE ASSOCIATION'S EXEMPT PURPOSE TO ASSIST WITH PARK INTERPRETATION AND INFORMATION.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: PROVIDES GRANTS AND DEVELOPS EDUCATIONAL MATERIALS AND PROGRAMS TO SUPPLEMENT PARK AND PUBLIC LAND INTERPRETIVE PROGRAMS. THE ASSOCIATION'S WORK IS GUIDED BY MEMORANDA OF AGREEMENT WITH THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE, US ARMY CORPS OF ENGINEERS AND OTHER ENTITIES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: BASED ON EVALUATION OF THE ASSOCIATION'S TAX POSITIONS FOR THE OPEN TAX YEARS, MANAGEMENT BELIEVES ALL POSITIONS TAKEN WOULD BE UPHELD UNDER AN EXAMINATION. THEREFORE, NO PROVISION FOR THE EFFECTS OF UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS HAS BEEN RECORDED FOR THE YEARS ENDED SEPTEMBER 30, 2021 AND 2022.

RecipientBusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: LOUISIANA MUSEUM OF AFRICAN AMERICAN HISTORY
VICKSBURG TABERNACLE NO 19 GRAND UNITED ORDER OF BROTHERS AND SISTERS

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: TO AID THE ASSOCIATION IN FURTHERING THE EDUCATIONAL, HISTORICAL AND INTERPRETIVE ACTIVITIES OF THE GATEWAY ARCH NATIONAL PARK (F/K/A JEFFERSON NATIONAL EXPANSION MEMORIAL) AND OTHER SITES AFFILIATED WITH THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE, THE ASSOCIATION HAS ENTERED INTO A COOPERATING ASSOCIATION AGREEMENT WITH THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE (NPS), AN AGENCY OF THE UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF THE INTERIOR. IN FULFILLMENT OF ITS PURPOSE, THE ASSOCIATION PROVIDES EMPLOYEES AND OTHER PAYMENTS ON BEHALF OF THE NPS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 1A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: AN EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE CONSISTING OF NOT LESS THAN FIVE DIRECTORS, INCLUDING ALL OFFICERS OF THE ASSOCIATION, SHALL HAVE AND EXERCISE THE AUTHORITY OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A COPY OF THE FORM 990 IS REVIEWED BY THE VICE PRESIDENT/CFO, PRESIDENT/CEO AND THE TREASURER IN ITS ENTIRETY. IT IS THEN PROVIDED TO THE FINANCE COMMITTEE FOR REVIEW AND APPROVAL. IT IS THEN SUBMITTED TO THE FULL BOARD PRIOR TO FILING THE RETURN WITH THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ASSOCIATION'S CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY REQUIRES OFFICERS, DIRECTORS AND KEY EMPLOYEES TO ANNUALLY FILE A DISCLOSURE STATEMENT OF ANY KNOWN OR POTENTIAL CONFLICTS OF INTEREST. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE REVIEWS ANY AFFIRMATIVE SUBMISSIONS AND RECOMMENDS APPROPRIATE ACTION BY THE FULL BOARD AS NEEDED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ASSOCIATION HAS ENTERED INTO AN EXECUTIVE EMPLOYMENT AGREEMENT WITH ITS PRESIDENT/CEO TO PROVIDE FOR THE DAILY ADMINISTRATION OF THE ASSOCIATION. TERMS OF THIS AGREEMENT, INLCUDING COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS, WERE DETERMINED BY EVALUATING LOCAL AND NATIONAL COMPARATIVE DATA FOR ORGANIZATIONS SIMILAR IN MISSION, BUDGET, SCOPE AND COMPLEXITY. INDUSTRY COMPENSATION REPORTS AND 990-REPORTED COMPENSATION WERE TAKEN INTO CONSIDERATION. THE LEVEL OF COMPENSATION WAS ESTABLISHED BY THE ASSOCIATION'S INDEPENDENT BOARD OF DIRECTORS, THROUGH THE RECOMMENDATION OF THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE. THE SALARY OF THE VICE PRESIDENT/CFO WAS DETERMINED THROUGH THE DEVELOPMENT OF AN ASSOCIATION-WIDE COMPENSATION POLICY AND PAY STRUCTURE. SALARIES AND BENEFITS WERE ESTABLISHED BASED ON COMPARABLE BENCHMARKS IN THE SAME GEOGRAPHIC EMPLOYMENT AREA FOR SIMILAR ORGANIZATIONS. PERFORMANCE IS REVIEWED ANNUALLY BY THE PRESIDENT/CEO AND MERIT ADJUSTMENTS ARE AWARDED AS WARRANTED. A WRITTEN PERFORMANCE REVIEW IS PREPARED ANNUALLY AND KEPT ON FILE WITH THE ASSOCIATION. THE ORGANIZATIONAL PAY SCALE, WHICH INCLUDES THE SALARY OF THE VICE PRESIDENT/CFO, IS ADJUSTED ANNUALLY BASED UPON THE CURRENT RATE OF INFLATION AND LOCAL MARKET CONDITIONS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ORGANIZATIONAL POLICIES, GOVERNING DOCUMENTS AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST MADE TO THE VICE PRESIDENT/CFO AT THE ASSOCIATION'S OFFICES. REQUESTERS MAY REVIEW THE DOCUMENTS IN PERSON OR REQUEST THAT COPIES BE SENT VIA MAIL OR E-MAIL. THE FORM 990 MAY ALSO BE OBTAINED FROM WWW.GUIDESTAR.ORG.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PAGE 12, PART XII, LINE 2C -AUDIT COMMITTEE
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THERE WERE NO CHANGES IN THE OVERSIGHT PROCESS OR SELECTION PROCESS DURING THE TAX YEAR.
